TextEquiv.Unicode: be caught up together with them in
the cloudes into the ayre to meete the
Lorde: and so shall we be with the
Lord for evermore.
Wee confesse therefore in this se
veth Article that wee beleeve there
shall bee an ende of all thinges in
this world, and that the felicitie of the
wicked shall not endure for ever. For
we beleve that God is a iust God who
hath given all judgement unto his
Son, to repay to everie one in that day
according to his works, paines to the
wicked that never shall be ended, and
to the godly ioyes everlasting. And so
in this Article wee professe that wee
looke for a deliverance, a ceasing from
troubbles, and the reward of life ever
lasting. For nowe shoulde hee destroy
them that beleeve in him, his people,
and his seruauntes, who in the most
true Gospell sayeth: verily l say unto
you that ye, which have followed me
in the regeneration, when the Sonne
of man shall sit on the seate of his ma
iestie, yee also shall sit upon twelve
seates iudging the twelve tribes of Is
raell. Ther are most certaine re
wardes and penalties appointed for
the godly ad ungodly in the worde of
trueth. He can not lie that saide to E
say, Say to the righteous that it shall
goe well with him, for he shall inioy
the fruite of his studie. But woe be to
the wicked, it shall be evill with him,
for he shall be rewarded according to
the workes of his owne handes. And
thus much touching the seconde part
of the Creede. Nowe are wee come to
the thirde part,
The eight Article of our beleife is
this, I beleeve in the holy Ghost. This
thirde part of the Creede contayneth
the propertie of the third person in the
reverend Trinitie. And we doe right
ly beleeve in the holy Ghost, as wel as

be caught up together with them in the cloudes into the ayre to meete the Lorde: and so shall we be with the Lord for evermore. Wee confesse therefore in this se veth Article that wee beleeve there shall bee an ende of all thinges in this world, and that the felicitie of the wicked shall not endure for ever. For we beleve that God is a iust God who hath given all judgement unto his Son, to repay to everie one in that day according to his works, paines to the wicked that never shall be ended, and to the godly ioyes everlasting. And so in this Article wee professe that wee looke for a deliverance, a ceasing from troubbles, and the reward of life ever lasting. For nowe shoulde hee destroy them that beleeve in him, his people, and his seruauntes, who in the most true Gospell sayeth: verily l say unto you that ye, which have followed me in the regeneration, when the Sonne of man shall sit on the seate of his ma iestie, yee also shall sit upon twelve seates iudging the twelve tribes of Is raell. Ther are most certaine re wardes and penalties appointed for the godly ad ungodly in the worde of trueth. He can not lie that saide to E say, Say to the righteous that it shall goe well with him, for he shall inioy the fruite of his studie. But woe be to the wicked, it shall be evill with him, for he shall be rewarded according to the workes of his owne handes. And thus much touching the seconde part of the Creede. Nowe are wee come to the thirde part, The eight Article of our beleife is this, I beleeve in the holy Ghost. This thirde part of the Creede contayneth the propertie of the third person in the reverend Trinitie. And we doe right ly beleeve in the holy Ghost, as wel as
in the father and the son. For the ho
ly Ghost is one God with the Father
and the Sonne:and rightly is faith in
the holy Ghost ioyned to faith in the
Father and the Sonne. For by him
the fruite of Gods salvation fulsilled
in the Sonne is sealed to us, and our
sanctification and cleansing is besto
wed on us, and derived from him to
us by the holy Ghost, For the Apo
stle saythr God which annointed us, is
he also which hath sealed us, and hath
given the earnest of the spirite in our
hearts. And againe, Te were in deede
desiled with naughtinesse, but nowe
yee are cleansed and sanetified, and
lastlie justified through the name of
the Lorde lesus, and by the spirite of
our God. The Father in deede doeth
sanctifie too, but by the bloud of Jesus
Christ, and powreth the same sanctifi
cation out of him into us by the holy
Ghost: so that it is as it were the pro
pertie of the holie Ghost to sanetifie,
whereupon hee is called Holy or the
sanctifier. Therefore so often as wee
heare the holie Ghost named, we must
by and by thinke of the polver in wor
king, which the Scripture attributeth
to him, and we must looke after the be
nefites that from him doe flowe to us,
For the polver, operation, or action of
the spirite is that, what so ever the
grace of God doth work in us through
the Sonne : so that of necessitie wee
must beleeve in the holie Ghost. And
in this eight Article we doe professe,
that we doe verily beleeve that all the
faithfull are cleansed, washed regene
rated, sanctified, inlightned, and inri
ched of God with divers gifts of grace
for Christ his sake, but yet through ye
holy Ghost. For without him there is
no true sanctification : wherefore we
ought not to attribute these giftes of
grace to any other meanes: this glory

in the father and the son. For the ho ly Ghost is one God with the Father and the Sonne:and rightly is faith in the holy Ghost ioyned to faith in the Father and the Sonne. For by him the fruite of Gods salvation fulsilled in the Sonne is sealed to us, and our sanctification and cleansing is besto wed on us, and derived from him to us by the holy Ghost, For the Apo stle saythr God which annointed us, is he also which hath sealed us, and hath given the earnest of the spirite in our hearts. And againe, Te were in deede desiled with naughtinesse, but nowe yee are cleansed and sanetified, and lastlie justified through the name of the Lorde lesus, and by the spirite of our God. The Father in deede doeth sanctifie too, but by the bloud of Jesus Christ, and powreth the same sanctifi cation out of him into us by the holy Ghost: so that it is as it were the pro pertie of the holie Ghost to sanetifie, whereupon hee is called Holy or the sanctifier. Therefore so often as wee heare the holie Ghost named, we must by and by thinke of the polver in wor king, which the Scripture attributeth to him, and we must looke after the be nefites that from him doe flowe to us, For the polver, operation, or action of the spirite is that, what so ever the grace of God doth work in us through the Sonne : so that of necessitie wee must beleeve in the holie Ghost. And in this eight Article we doe professe, that we doe verily beleeve that all the faithfull are cleansed, washed regene rated, sanctified, inlightned, and inri ched of God with divers gifts of grace for Christ his sake, but yet through ye holy Ghost. For without him there is no true sanctification : wherefore we ought not to attribute these giftes of grace to any other meanes: this glory
